/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%201.jpeg: Dominic, Nick, and Gretta arrive in Danbury, Connecticut, visiting Nick's twin sister, Anya.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: Behind schedule, we were in and out of Danbury lickety split, leaving later that night.
Dominic and his 1983 Mercedes wagon turned biodiesel, 3 bikes atop the auxiliary fuel tank.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%204.jpeg: Having pilfered waste cooking oil, we used thrift store t-shirts to filter it.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%206.jpeg: Filtered cooking oil is lifted up the roof, then emptied into the auxiliary fuel tank.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: Arriving at Frank and Dolores, near Iona, Nova Scotia.
Dinner with Frank and Dolores, friends of friends.
Heading out from Frank & Dolores' place.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2012.jpeg: Scenery on our first day of riding. Idyllic, no?
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: A bulging tube, wrapped in paper to reinforce it, is inserted into Dominic's tire.
Clearly, that didn't hold. Our tire is good and flat. We are stuck all extra tubes now exploded!
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2024.jpeg: At the end of this road, we thought we'd find a spot to camp to wait out the rain and deal with tire issues.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: A surgical approach was hatched!
It worked, but not very long, exploding before we could get out of camp.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2030.jpeg: What to do now? Bikes are strewn around in apparent chaos, but there is a plan!
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2032.jpeg: A tandem bike is built to get around having only 3 functioning wheels for two bikes. It did move, but having two pivot points made it ultimately impossible to ride.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: We made friends with a local up on the highway, who kindly hauled us into Sydney. Big enough to have a bike shop (and mostly on our way)!
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2036.jpeg: For extra warmth, we visited a thrift store. Nick cut the sleeves off this fleece...
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: To form knee warmers!
Gretta, an excellent fiddle player, tries her hand at Sydney's giant fiddle, built 3 years earlier.
Camping outside a friendly resident's house in North Sydney, we warmed by the fire, ready to take the ferry to Newfoundland in the morning.
Pizza in dramatic fashion is now in hand. (Gretta wants to eat it!!)
Dominic too, checking out the beautiful view,  before heading belowdecks.
Pizza and cards on the 7 hour ferry ride.
Nick rubs in the round trouncing he delivers by snapping a photo.
Arriving at Channel-Port aux Basque (Newfoundland) at 11:30pm, we bid adieu the next morning.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2052.jpeg: Dominic freshens up in a lake along our bike ride.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: Some minor maintenance on an otherwise smooth day.
The weather is holding much better in Newfoundland!
Dusk at campsite, after a gloriously hassle-free day of real riding, the first in quite some time.
Camping again. A beautiful photo, though one altered by the camera settings to add yellow.

Aaron, a friend we "brought home from the (gas) bar" (what they call gas stations), poses for a photo. Gas stations made good central gathering points in the otherwise vast expanse of Newfoundland's single main highway.
Dominic tries to nap after seeing our friend off at HIS rising time, 6am. By 7am, Dominic was napping.
Gretta won't have it. She takes a hit of maple syrup...
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2060.jpeg: Heated up and ready to ride a few minutes later, she tries to wrestle Dominic out of his stupor.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: But Dominic gets the best of her.
Arriving to our first big town in Newfoundland, Corner Brook (pop. 20K) we enjoy the afternoon and then make camp.
The next day, we indulge, sleeping in and reading.
Laying in the sun, lovebirds Dominic and Gretta find a way to snuggle and read at the same time.
And then they cut a rug at a town festival.
We finally meet up with Ryan, a couchsurfer connection who will be hosting us in Corner Brook this next night.
We just have to point out all the berries we found along the way. Strawberries here!
Wild raspberries!
Tart cherries!
With the cherries eventually making a delicious syrup for our pancakes.
Woody Point lighthouse was iconic.
Pink clouds cover the bay as we set camp.
After a lovely night of camping, we bid farewell to Woody Point, as the water taxi takes us across the bay to Norris Point.
/media/Map%20with%20Arrows.jpeg: Ferries connect various points on this map of Newfoundland. (Part of our secret plan to make a loop.)
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%2099.jpeg: Gorgeous sunset at our camp site, right on the water.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20108.jpeg: Arches Provincial Park, Dominic adds some challenge to the short hike.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20114.jpeg: A human arch mirrors the earthen arch below.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20121.jpeg: Camping on a peat bog. It is soo soooofft.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20102.jpeg: Pitcher plants abounded in this rocky, peaty terrain.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20101.jpeg: This pitcher plant has some food to digest.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20122.jpeg: It wasn't safe to get much closer to this massive moose.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20103.jpeg: A bird alights on Dominic's hand.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: On our hike sign, the picture of the man climbing a sheer face was an exaggeration, but not much of one.
It was a seemingly endless scramble up steep rocks during what ended up being a 7-hour hike.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20124.jpeg: Our primary cooking device, a space efficient pressure cooker.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: Dominic, eating in style.
Loading up the pressure cooker.
Another dish, which may not look appetizing, but was assuredly delicious.
Popcorn! What couldn't we do?
With a real oven in Corner Brook, we made delicious shepherd's pie, a vegan variety for our host Ryan.
In the morning, Ryan made us traditional Toutons, doughy biscuits fried and then covered in molasses. A Newfie specialty!
Splitting off from the Trans-Can. Hwy, we headed down the road towards Burgeo, a 150-km isolated stretch.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20140.jpeg: Lakes kept us cool along the way. Here's the vantage point over one.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: A day later, we arrive in Burgeo on the southwestern coast of Newfoundland.
We take the ferry to Ramea, an island town of 462 southeast of Burgeo, and then climb Man o' War Hill.
We feast that night with Jim and Judie, some folks we'd been communicating with on couchsurfing.com prior to arriving in Ramea.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20115.jpeg: On an early stretch in Newfoundland, one of Nick's spokes sheared in two when his pannier flew into it--a combination of poor strap design and uneven Newfie roads.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20120.jpeg: We sewed and sealed the bag with shoe goo.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20117.jpeg: Frank's Badass Bailing Wire was used to reconnect the spoke, then true the wheel.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: Rebuilding Nick's axle in Ramea, which unbeknownst to us had fractured at some point earlier.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20155.jpeg: We ferried over to Grand Bruit, a fishing town and outport community only reachable by boat. Year round population: <15.
/geotagged2/Nova_Newfie%20-%20153.jpeg: On GB's 4-foot wide roads, this good boy picked out the largest stick he could find for a game of fetch. Later, at the urging of the locals, we camped right on the dock.
/geotagged/Newfoundland%20and%20Nova%20S: Back in Channel-Port aux Basque, we splurged, making pizza-on-the-ferry a tradition for the boat ride back to Nova Scotia. Yum.
Waking up on our last day in Nova Scotia, Dominic's tent was sopping wet.
No, really wet.
The rain, having returned to greet us for our riding again in NS, lasted all night, turning our campsite into a shallow bog.
But at least it was convenient to wash our hands.
And our dishes!
After arriving back with Frank and Dolores near Iona, the terminus of our trip, we harvested blackberries and apples nearby and made pie!
Posing in front of their house, we bid Frank and Dolores farewell before hitting the road in Dominic's greasemobile.
Over several steps, we replaced a broken valve stem.
The journey continues, this time up the Great Northern Peninsula.
This was the summit on a relatively "clear" day.
Did we mention we loved the sunsets?
